tweets.text: Working alongside our partners, the fantastic natural #flood risk management scheme at Smithills #Bolton continues to make excellent progress! This week large stone dams have been installed to #slowtheflow & work with the peatland restoration project to enhance our environment https://t.co/NBL4rwIY4d

@standona120 @HighwaysEAST @EnvAgency @EastHerts What about the safety of people living along the diversion route? I find this reasoning unacceptable. My betting is they can easily keep 1 lane open but just can‚Äôt be arsed to do it.

@trent900uk @HighwaysEAST @EnvAgency @EastHerts I understand the safety implications of crews working right next to live lanes and therefore why closures are necessary but this diversion via the a120 is just no longer safe either due to the volume of traffic & also (ironically) the number of new developments & side roads.

tweets.text: @StinkStopthe @JeremyVineOn5 @EnvAgency @PHE_uk @BBCPanorama @ITVTonight we need a voice so someone will listen to us. We have toxic gases in our homes, schools and hospitals on a daily basis from the landfill. We have people ill and thinking of ending their life because they can't cope any longer. Please give us a voice.

tweets.text: Last week, I miscarried my baby. I had a level 4 haemorrhage and was rushed into life saving surgery. The only memory I have of leaving our home is the ambulance crew saying ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt now how you can live with this smell.‚Äù@StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgency @Sotlive

@Sarah_Winckless @theboatrace @matthewcpinsent @JenBartram @BBCSport @jamescracknell @CUBCsquad @stuartatcorpus @clarebalding @NatureUK @EnvAgency @metpoliceuk @MetPolice @OxfordUniBC @CambsCops @DanielZeichner @ClarenceHouse @EnvAgencyAnglia @Cambridge_Uni @PryorFrancis @cam_uni Wittlesea Police officers are so ill-informed on Environmental Law that they asked if I wanted the empty cement bag back. I explained that it too was Cambridge University litter, so they incinerated it, despite my pro bono objection @EnvAgency failed to do their job. Intimidated.

tweets.text:
Mystery Common Toad massacre in Cut-off Channel! 
c10 bodies, lacking their rear portion, scattered over riverbed between A11 & A1065 - only one live individual.  Assume this is a natural predator - otter? - rather than slaughter by humans harvesting 'toads legs'? 

#MySwim 1/6 https://t.co/xAgFL1KJXU

We went down to the Aldersbrook today to check that the sewage discharges had fully stopped and to assess the damage to the brook and the River Roding. Absolutely shocked and saddened to discover that the discharges are still happening *9 days* after we first reported them. https://t.co/pvKK1VglKQ

Do you know how frightening every night, to wonder if your sleep will be disturbed by toxic gasses? No windows open no doors open to bring a breath of coolair just poison @ClareDinnisEA @MattHancock @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WHO @ErinBrockovich Walleyslandfill

Slightly more difficult to the North because it‚Äôs only 3 lane, but still doable. I can‚Äôt really see any issue. Maybe we need to organise an #A120 closure! üòâ

What are you doing about this @EnvAgency ?

@sianberry @CarolineLucas promise to stop this happening and you'll get my vote.. https://t.co/urUqL1xeMu

tweets.text: Day 1 of #50teams50days - sharing more on the work of #TeamEA. Today I highlight the heart of our flood response - our forecasting work. Blending local river forecasts with @Metoffice supercomputer outputs to help deliver flood warnings to 1.4 million signed up to the service! https://t.co/NPkxowX38a
We were called in to clear up the mess... #Lewisham #RiverQuaggy #waste #flytipping #RightWasteRightPlace https://t.co/3cdcGaId3u

@trent900uk @HighwaysEAST @EnvAgency It just feels like the village of Standon & Puckeridge is being sacrificed for the maintenance of the road transport network ü§î
@EastHerts are fully aware of the noise and vibration impact of these all too regular nigh-time diversions.

Not only has the @EnvAgency reduced itself to becoming nothing more than a hot bed of mediocrity and incompetence it appears it now also become an apologist and spin doctor for the water industry.

Over 3,100,000 hours worth of sewage dumped into our rivers in 2020. Shame on you. https://t.co/itIVQGDyk1

@standona120 @HighwaysEAST This is a difficult one to deal with. Maybe the @EnvAgency can point in the right location to be a able to put a complaint in regard the noise and disruption? @HighwaysEAST need new management and working practices as well!

@trent900uk @HighwaysEAST It‚Äôs no longer a suitable diversion. The volume of HGVs travelling through the village at motorway speed for minimum 8 hours a night is incompatible with a residential area.  Excessive noise/vibration adversely affects people‚Äôs quality of life. Speeding endangers other road users
